okay but actually i didnt know it was called a colander before the whole 3x13 drama. i always just called it a strainer.
so i...
body:
okay but actually i didnt know it was called a colander before the whole 3x13 drama. i always just called it a strainer.

so i guess andi mack teaches me vocab as well as heartbreak!

blog.name: heyoricohannah
blog.title: “I’m pretty petty and that’s a pity”

summary:
Post Bar Mitzvah Part 11:
“Guys, I’ve come up with the perfect way to rekindle things between me and Marty.” 
Sitting down next...
body:
Post Bar Mitzvah Part 11:

“Guys, I’ve come up with the perfect way to rekindle things between me and Marty.”

Sitting down next to Andi and across from the boys, this is how Buffy greets her friends at lunch.

“How?” They’re all looking pretty forward to hearing it.

“I’m gonna make him my slave.”

She wasn’t expecting such intense grimaces. “What??” She asks.

“Buffy,” Cyrus doesn’t even try to hide his impatience. “Technically, Marty didn’t even do anything wrong.”

“Yes he did…!” She claims.

“What.” Andi asks.

“Potentially outed Cyrus.”

“To who, two people who don’t even go to school here?” Cyrus asks. “You’re the one that ditched him.”

“Yeah! If anything you should be his slave!” Andi says.

“How can I do that when I’m leaving tomorrow.”

“Exactly.” TJ says. “What would he even do for you until that time.”

“You know, help me during tonight’s game, pack my things for me…”

“You still haven’t packed?” Jonah asks.

“That’s what he’s going to be my slave for!” She exclaims. “We all agree that he still has feelings for me. So why wouldn’t he??”

“Buffy I don’t think you understand how these things work.” Jonah tells her, the rest of them besides her agreeing.

“Buffy, you have to own up to what you did wrong.” TJ says. “I did. Do you just want me to pack your things for you?” He offers kindly.

“No you won’t do it right.”

His mouth drops open in offense.

“I’m getting food.” She announces, standing up and separating herself from their area.

“Raise your hand if she’s being mean.” TJ throws his hand in the air, Jonah and Cyrus instantly joining him.

TJ takes Andi’s wrist and raises her hand for her.

“Guys.” She puts her hand down. “I agree her trying to make Marty the bad the guy is totally unreasonable.”

“What if he was the bad guy?” Cyrus asks, he and the other guys’ hands back in place. “Maybe there’s something she hasn’t told us.”

“She would’ve told us.” Andi states.

“Well,” says Cyrus. “For this whole thing to be justifiable, Marty has to do something completely despicable to Buffy within the next twenty four hours.”

Something they personally don’t see happening.


Well, they don’t know how they did it, but Buffy’s friends have managed to convince her to genuinely apologize to Marty and own up about refusing to speak to him.

During gym class, during track, of all things, Buffy civilly approaches Marty, where he stands to the side talking to friends of his.

“Hey Marty…” Her hands fold together.

“Oh. Hey Buffy…” Marty, nor his friends, seem to find her presence very amusing.

“So…I just wanted to let you know that I’m leaving tomorrow.”

“Really?” He scoffs. “Good.”

As much as she feels he has the right to react like this, she frowns and bites her tongue.

“Well…You have every right to be mad at me, so…”

“And you have every right to not be here. No one wants you around, anyway.” Marty says, him and his friends snickering.

“Excuse me?” Buffy scowls. Now he’s gone too far.

“Don’t bother showing up to the game tonight. We’ll be a much better team without you.” Marty gets the last word, Buffy now fuming to the sound of their laughter and fighting back tears as she jogs away.

“You’re not going very fast!” Marty and his friends laugh even harder, causing for Buffy to sprint faster than she ever has before.

Unfortunately for her, they don’t even care enough to watch.

When Buffy runs up crying to her friends in the halls after she finished avoiding the rest of class, the first thing Cyrus does is give her a hug.

“What’s happening?” TJ asks. “Are you moving somewhere further away?! Like Canada?!”

“No.” Buffy looks at him after separating herself from Cyrus. “Marty’s a jerk. That’s what’s happening. I tried to apologize and all he did was insult me.”

“What?!” Andi flusters up. “He has no reason to act like that!”

“Maybe he does…” Buffy sniffles.

“No.” Jonah insists. “It’s not like you ever said anything mean to him.”

“What a germ. I say we kick him.” TJ declares.

“Now he has to be my slave!” Buffy yells.

“What makes you think he’ll agree to that?” Andi asks.

“We’ll make him be her slave. By kicking him.” TJ instructs.

Jonah and Cyrus vaguely glance at each other.

“I have a better idea.” Buffy says.

“What?” TJ asks.

“I don’t know yet. But I know it’ll be better than yours.”

He frowns.

“Oh, I’m gonna beat him so hard.” Buffy grunts.

“He’s on your team.” Andi states.

“I’m talking about beating him up!”

TJ automatically supports the idea.

“Just show him that you’re the better player.” Andi likes this idea a lot better.

So, because Buffy makes sure that she’ll be playing better than Marty, she and TJ practice harder than ever before, kicking the others out so that they can focus on cooperating and succeeding.

To give them their privacy, the remaining boys and Andi spend their time at The Spoon.

“So I guess Marty’s her own worst enemy now, huh?” Andi asks, sitting across from the two of them in their booth.

“Guess so.” Jonah responds.

“You’re not gonna still try and be his friend, right?” Andi cringes at Cyrus.

“Why do you ask that?”

“Because, when TJ was still being mean to Buffy you went on and befriended him anyway.”

“That was unintentional.”

“Okay well if Marty doesn’t apologize to her you’re not allowed within ten feet of him.” Andi plans.

“What makes you think he’d want to be friends with me after how he treated Buffy?” Cyrus asks.

“Because. Even when TJ was mean to her he still wanted to be friends with you. The same could happen with Marty.” Andi makes her point.

“It’s true.” Jonah agrees. “It’s like you have some sort of secret charm.”

Cyrus takes that as a compliment. “Well he did fist bump me…” He thoughtfully considers.

“Uh-oh…” Jonah looks over at the entrance.

“Amber?” Andi assumes.

“Marty.”

Andi and Cyrus whip their heads over and see that it’s unfortunately so, watching as Marty walks forward inside with his friends who are all talking up a storm.

“Maybe he won’t notice us…” Cyrus says.

“Should we say something?” Jonah asks.

“What if he emotionally abuses us next?” Cyrus brings up, causing Andi to glare his way.

“Just don’t talk to him.” Jonah mutters directly to Cyrus, insecurely looking down in his lap and causing Cyrus to puzzlingly glance over.

Interestingly enough, Amber is also there, but that’s not the main problem right now.

“Amber.” Andi whispers to her the moment she approaches their table. “You see that guy over there?” She points to Marty.

“The guy with the temperamental issues?” She remembers him.

“Yeah. Contaminate his food.”

The boys furrow their brows in Andi’s direction.

“What?” She doesn’t see an issue.

Amber casually declines the order.


Luckily, the three of them were able to sneak out without Marty noticing, and twenty four hours later, it’s just a few more hours until Buffy’s last basketball game here at the school.

She and TJ had a pretty good practice yesterday, so she’s feeling pretty confident.

“What are you doing.” She asks, currently standing in front of him with Andi and the other boys right outside of the gym, where she has be inside any minute.

“Math stuff.” He’s focusing on the textbook he holds below his face.

“And you’re just…Reading the problems…” Andi doesn’t see him holding anything to write with.

“Right now I have to focus on reading math instead of doing it.” He keeps his eyes on the pages.

“Sounds like an excuse but okay.” Buffy comments.

“It isn’t!” He glares up at her.

“Whatever. Can you just make sure Marty doesn’t try anything with me during the game?” She swipes the book away from him and slams it shut.

“Copy that. Let’s go underdog.” He says to Cyrus, motioning him along as he’s about to take his first step forward.

“You do know what underdog means, right…” Andi asks him.

“No…”

Buffy has to whisper the definition in his ear, which brings nothing but shocked embarrassment to his expression.

“Oh, uh, let’s go, then…Cy’ guy.”

“That’s my thing!” Jonah proclaims.

“I’ll think of something better later.” TJ claims this and races inside, leaving Buffy cringing and handing the math textbook to Andi. “Don’t give him this.”

Andi, Cyrus and Jonah meet TJ on the third to last row of the bleachers, where they find him watching the tiger mascot jumping and dancing around.

“I think I have a crush on the mascot.” He reveals.

“Who are they?” Andi looks at him.

“No, not who plays the mascot, but like, the mascot.”

Understandably enough, this earns him a few concerning stares from those sitting with him.

“TJ, do we need to talk about something?” Cyrus asks.

“No! Okay? That-that came out wrong…”

Though Cyrus doesn’t think that that isn’t the only thing that ‘came out wrong.’

“Well who knows, maybe whoever plays the mascot is your one and only soulmate.” Andi jokes.

“Don’t test me.”

During the actual game, in the middle of cheering Buffy on, whose team is doing fairly well against their opponents, Andi shares with the boys her idea that she’s just miraculously come up with.

“We should make a time capsule for Buffy!” She yells over the cheers of the part of the crowd supporting the opposing team scoring a point. “Ya know, put stuff in there there’s meaningful and represents our friendship with her.”

The guys pleasantly support this idea, and when unexpectedly hearing commotion coming from both the crowd and the game itself, they look over and see that Buffy’s been roughly pushed down to the ground by one of her ruthless opponents.

“Buffy!” Andi yells, standing up with the rest of the crowd in concern, glancing to the boys in utter surprise when Marty is seen to be the one helping Buffy up, looking just as flustered and angered at the opponent at fault just as everyone else.

Letting go of her hands, Marty quickly returns her supportive nod, demanding to the opponent in question what his problem is before the whistle blows and proceeds the game.

In the end, their team is led to victory, and for the sake of celebration, Buffy and Marty give each other double high fives.

“You still have to be my slave.” Buffy insists to him outside the gym, where she approached him immediately afterwards.

“Your what…” He asks.

“You think a quick save and a high five is gonna fix things? You never even passed me the ball.”

“I barely had the ball..!”

“My house. Tomorrow. Eleven a.m. You’re packing my things for me.”

“What?!”

When strutting away from him, she purposely provides no response.

“What makes you think he’d want to be friends with me after how he treated Buffy?” Cyrus asks.

“Because. Even when TJ was mean to her he still wanted to be friends with you. The same could happen with Marty.” Andi makes her point.

“It’s true.” Jonah agrees. “It’s like you have some sort of secret charm.”

Cyrus takes that as a compliment. “Well he did fist bump me…” He thoughtfully considers.

“Uh-oh…” Jonah looks over at the entrance.

“Amber?” Andi assumes.

“Marty.”

Andi and Cyrus whip their heads over and see that it’s unfortunately so, watching as Marty walks forward inside with his friends who are all talking up a storm.

“Maybe he won’t notice us…” Cyrus says.

“Should we say something?” Jonah asks.

“What if he emotionally abuses us next?” Cyrus brings up, causing Andi to glare his way.

“Just don’t talk to him.” Jonah mutters directly to Cyrus, insecurely looking down in his lap and causing Cyrus to puzzlingly glance over.

Interestingly enough, Amber is also there, but that’s not the main problem right now.

“Amber.” Andi whispers to her the moment she approaches their table. “You see that guy over there?” She points to Marty.

“The guy with the temperamental issues?” She remembers him.

“Yeah. Contaminate his food.”

The boys furrow their brows in Andi’s direction.

“What?” She doesn’t see an issue.

Amber casually declines the order.


Luckily, the three of them were able to sneak out without Marty noticing, and twenty four hours later, it’s just a few more hours until Buffy’s last basketball game here at the school.

She and TJ had a pretty good practice yesterday, so she’s feeling pretty confident.

“What are you doing.” She asks, currently standing in front of him with Andi and the other boys right outside of the gym, where she has be inside any minute.

“Math stuff.” He’s focusing on the textbook he holds below his face.

“And you’re just…Reading the problems…” Andi doesn’t see him holding anything to write with.

“Right now I have to focus on reading math instead of doing it.” He keeps his eyes on the pages.

“Sounds like an excuse but okay.” Buffy comments.

“It isn’t!” He glares up at her.

“Whatever. Can you just make sure Marty doesn’t try anything with me during the game?” She swipes the book away from him and slams it shut.

“Copy that. Let’s go underdog.” He says to Cyrus, motioning him along as he’s about to take his first step forward.

“You do know what underdog means, right…” Andi asks him.

“No…”

Buffy has to whisper the definition in his ear, which brings nothing but shocked embarrassment to his expression.

“Oh, uh, let’s go, then…Cy’ guy.”

“That’s my thing!” Jonah proclaims.

“I’ll think of something better later.” TJ claims this and races inside, leaving Buffy cringing and handing the math textbook to Andi. “Don’t give him this.”

Andi, Cyrus and Jonah meet TJ on the third to last row of the bleachers, where they find him watching the tiger mascot jumping and dancing around.

“I think I have a crush on the mascot.” He reveals.

“Who are they?” Andi looks at him.

“No, not who plays the mascot, but like, the mascot.”

Understandably enough, this earns him a few concerning stares from those sitting with him.

“TJ, do we need to talk about something?” Cyrus asks.

“No! Okay? That-that came out wrong…”

Though Cyrus doesn’t think that that isn’t the only thing that ‘came out wrong.’

“Well who knows, maybe whoever plays the mascot is your one and only soulmate.” Andi jokes.

“Don’t test me.”

During the actual game, in the middle of cheering Buffy on, whose team is doing fairly well against their opponents, Andi shares with the boys her idea that she’s just miraculously come up with.

“We should make a time capsule for Buffy!” She yells over the cheers of the part of the crowd supporting the opposing team scoring a point. “Ya know, put stuff in there there’s meaningful and represents our friendship with her.”

The guys pleasantly support this idea, and when unexpectedly hearing commotion coming from both the crowd and the game itself, they look over and see that Buffy’s been roughly pushed down to the ground by one of her ruthless opponents.

“Buffy!” Andi yells, standing up with the rest of the crowd in concern, glancing to the boys in utter surprise when Marty is seen to be the one helping Buffy up, looking just as flustered and angered at the opponent at fault just as everyone else.

Letting go of her hands, Marty quickly returns her supportive nod, demanding to the opponent in question what his problem is before the whistle blows and proceeds the game.

In the end, their team is led to victory, and for the sake of celebration, Buffy and Marty give each other double high fives.

“You still have to be my slave.” Buffy insists to him outside the gym, where she approached him immediately afterwards.

“Your what…” He asks.

“You think a quick save and a high five is gonna fix things? You never even passed me the ball.”

“I barely had the ball..!”

“My house. Tomorrow. Eleven a.m. You’re packing my things for me.”

“What?!”

When strutting away from him, she purposely provides no response.
trail.content:
Post Bar Mitzvah Part 11:

“Guys, I’ve come up with the perfect way to rekindle things between me and Marty.”

Sitting down next to Andi and across from the boys, this is how Buffy greets her friends at lunch.

“How?” They’re all looking pretty forward to hearing it.

“I’m gonna make him my slave.”

She wasn’t expecting such intense grimaces. “What??” She asks.

“Buffy,” Cyrus doesn’t even try to hide his impatience. “Technically, Marty didn’t even do anything wrong.”

“Yes he did…!” She claims.

“What.” Andi asks.

“Potentially outed Cyrus.”

“To who, two people who don’t even go to school here?” Cyrus asks. “You’re the one that ditched him.”

“Yeah! If anything you should be his slave!” Andi says.

“How can I do that when I’m leaving tomorrow.”

“Exactly.” TJ says. “What would he even do for you until that time.”

“You know, help me during tonight’s game, pack my things for me…”

“You still haven’t packed?” Jonah asks.

“That’s what he’s going to be my slave for!” She exclaims. “We all agree that he still has feelings for me. So why wouldn’t he??”

“Buffy I don’t think you understand how these things work.” Jonah tells her, the rest of them besides her agreeing.

“Buffy, you have to own up to what you did wrong.” TJ says. “I did. Do you just want me to pack your things for you?” He offers kindly.

“No you won’t do it right.”

His mouth drops open in offense.

“I’m getting food.” She announces, standing up and separating herself from their area.

“Raise your hand if she’s being mean.” TJ throws his hand in the air, Jonah and Cyrus instantly joining him.

TJ takes Andi’s wrist and raises her hand for her.

“Guys.” She puts her hand down. “I agree her trying to make Marty the bad the guy is totally unreasonable.”

“What if he was the bad guy?” Cyrus asks, he and the other guys’ hands back in place. “Maybe there’s something she hasn’t told us.”

“She would’ve told us.” Andi states.

“Well,” says Cyrus. “For this whole thing to be justifiable, Marty has to do something completely despicable to Buffy within the next twenty four hours.”

Something they personally don’t see happening.


Well, they don’t know how they did it, but Buffy’s friends have managed to convince her to genuinely apologize to Marty and own up about refusing to speak to him.

During gym class, during track, of all things, Buffy civilly approaches Marty, where he stands to the side talking to friends of his.

“Hey Marty…” Her hands fold together.

“Oh. Hey Buffy…” Marty, nor his friends, seem to find her presence very amusing.

“So…I just wanted to let you know that I’m leaving tomorrow.”

“Really?” He scoffs. “Good.”

As much as she feels he has the right to react like this, she frowns and bites her tongue.

“Well…You have every right to be mad at me, so…”

“And you have every right to not be here. No one wants you around, anyway.” Marty says, him and his friends snickering.

“Excuse me?” Buffy scowls. Now he’s gone too far.

“Don’t bother showing up to the game tonight. We’ll be a much better team without you.” Marty gets the last word, Buffy now fuming to the sound of their laughter and fighting back tears as she jogs away.

“You’re not going very fast!” Marty and his friends laugh even harder, causing for Buffy to sprint faster than she ever has before.

Unfortunately for her, they don’t even care enough to watch.

When Buffy runs up crying to her friends in the halls after she finished avoiding the rest of class, the first thing Cyrus does is give her a hug.

“What’s happening?” TJ asks. “Are you moving somewhere further away?! Like Canada?!”

“No.” Buffy looks at him after separating herself from Cyrus. “Marty’s a jerk. That’s what’s happening. I tried to apologize and all he did was insult me.”

“What?!” Andi flusters up. “He has no reason to act like that!”

“Maybe he does…” Buffy sniffles.

“No.” Jonah insists. “It’s not like you ever said anything mean to him.”

“What a germ. I say we kick him.” TJ declares.

“Now he has to be my slave!” Buffy yells.

“What makes you think he’ll agree to that?” Andi asks.

“We’ll make him be her slave. By kicking him.” TJ instructs.

Jonah and Cyrus vaguely glance at each other.

“I have a better idea.” Buffy says.

“What?” TJ asks.

“I don’t know yet. But I know it’ll be better than yours.”

He frowns.

“Oh, I’m gonna beat him so hard.” Buffy grunts.

“He’s on your team.” Andi states.

“I’m talking about beating him up!”

TJ automatically supports the idea.

“Just show him that you’re the better player.” Andi likes this idea a lot better.

So, because Buffy makes sure that she’ll be playing better than Marty, she and TJ practice harder than ever before, kicking the others out so that they can focus on cooperating and succeeding.

To give them their privacy, the remaining boys and Andi spend their time at The Spoon.

“So I guess Marty’s her own worst enemy now, huh?” Andi asks, sitting across from the two of them in their booth.

“Guess so.” Jonah responds.

“You’re not gonna still try and be his friend, right?” Andi cringes at Cyrus.

“Why do you ask that?”

“Because, when TJ was still being mean to Buffy you went on and befriended him anyway.”

“That was unintentional.”

“Okay well if Marty doesn’t apologize to her you’re not allowed within ten feet of him.” Andi plans.

“What makes you think he’d want to be friends with me after how he treated Buffy?” Cyrus asks.

“Because. Even when TJ was mean to her he still wanted to be friends with you. The same could happen with Marty.” Andi makes her point.

“It’s true.” Jonah agrees. “It’s like you have some sort of secret charm.”

Cyrus takes that as a compliment. “Well he did fist bump me…” He thoughtfully considers.

“Uh-oh…” Jonah looks over at the entrance.

“Amber?” Andi assumes.

“Marty.”

Andi and Cyrus whip their heads over and see that it’s unfortunately so, watching as Marty walks forward inside with his friends who are all talking up a storm.

“Maybe he won’t notice us…” Cyrus says.

“Should we say something?” Jonah asks.

“What if he emotionally abuses us next?” Cyrus brings up, causing Andi to glare his way.

“Just don’t talk to him.” Jonah mutters directly to Cyrus, insecurely looking down in his lap and causing Cyrus to puzzlingly glance over.

Interestingly enough, Amber is also there, but that’s not the main problem right now.

“Amber.” Andi whispers to her the moment she approaches their table. “You see that guy over there?” She points to Marty.

“The guy with the temperamental issues?” She remembers him.

“Yeah. Contaminate his food.”

The boys furrow their brows in Andi’s direction.

“What?” She doesn’t see an issue.

Amber casually declines the order.


Luckily, the three of them were able to sneak out without Marty noticing, and twenty four hours later, it’s just a few more hours until Buffy’s last basketball game here at the school.

She and TJ had a pretty good practice yesterday, so she’s feeling pretty confident.

“What are you doing.” She asks, currently standing in front of him with Andi and the other boys right outside of the gym, where she has be inside any minute.

“Math stuff.” He’s focusing on the textbook he holds below his face.

“And you’re just…Reading the problems…” Andi doesn’t see him holding anything to write with.

“Right now I have to focus on reading math instead of doing it.” He keeps his eyes on the pages.

“Sounds like an excuse but okay.” Buffy comments.

“It isn’t!” He glares up at her.

“Whatever. Can you just make sure Marty doesn’t try anything with me during the game?” She swipes the book away from him and slams it shut.

“Copy that. Let’s go underdog.” He says to Cyrus, motioning him along as he’s about to take his first step forward.

“You do know what underdog means, right…” Andi asks him.

“No…”

Buffy has to whisper the definition in his ear, which brings nothing but shocked embarrassment to his expression.

“Oh, uh, let’s go, then…Cy’ guy.”

“That’s my thing!” Jonah proclaims.

“I’ll think of something better later.” TJ claims this and races inside, leaving Buffy cringing and handing the math textbook to Andi. “Don’t give him this.”

Andi, Cyrus and Jonah meet TJ on the third to last row of the bleachers, where they find him watching the tiger mascot jumping and dancing around.

“I think I have a crush on the mascot.” He reveals.

“Who are they?” Andi looks at him.

“No, not who plays the mascot, but like, the mascot.”

Understandably enough, this earns him a few concerning stares from those sitting with him.

“TJ, do we need to talk about something?” Cyrus asks.

“No! Okay? That-that came out wrong…”

Though Cyrus doesn’t think that that isn’t the only thing that ‘came out wrong.’

“Well who knows, maybe whoever plays the mascot is your one and only soulmate.” Andi jokes.

“Don’t test me.”

During the actual game, in the middle of cheering Buffy on, whose team is doing fairly well against their opponents, Andi shares with the boys her idea that she’s just miraculously come up with.

“We should make a time capsule for Buffy!” She yells over the cheers of the part of the crowd supporting the opposing team scoring a point. “Ya know, put stuff in there there’s meaningful and represents our friendship with her.”

The guys pleasantly support this idea, and when unexpectedly hearing commotion coming from both the crowd and the game itself, they look over and see that Buffy’s been roughly pushed down to the ground by one of her ruthless opponents.

“Buffy!” Andi yells, standing up with the rest of the crowd in concern, glancing to the boys in utter surprise when Marty is seen to be the one helping Buffy up, looking just as flustered and angered at the opponent at fault just as everyone else.

Letting go of her hands, Marty quickly returns her supportive nod, demanding to the opponent in question what his problem is before the whistle blows and proceeds the game.

In the end, their team is led to victory, and for the sake of celebration, Buffy and Marty give each other double high fives.

“You still have to be my slave.” Buffy insists to him outside the gym, where she approached him immediately afterwards.

“Your what…” He asks.

“You think a quick save and a high five is gonna fix things? You never even passed me the ball.”

“I barely had the ball..!”

“My house. Tomorrow. Eleven a.m. You’re packing my things for me.”

“What?!”

When strutting away from him, she purposely provides no response.
